content.webTitle: Arsenal fan suffers suspected stab wound before Champions League match with Roma

fields.headline: Arsenal fan suffers suspected stab wound before Roma match
fields.bodyText: An Arsenal fan received a suspected stab wound in the leg near the Olympic Stadium last night after the mini-bus taking him to the game was ambushed by Roma fans. The privately hired minibus was close to the stadium at around 7pm when it was surrounded by fans who stoned and kicked it. A spokesman for the British embassy said: "Roma fans entered the bus and the Arsenal fan was either stabbed or injured by broken glass when a window of the minibus was smashed." Police intervened, arresting one Roma fan and escorted the minibus to the stadium. The wounded fan, who has not been named, was treated at a medical centre at the stadium before returning to watch the game. In a separate incident, two other Arsenal fans were injured after a fight with Roma supporters.
